alert.note: Alert for Cuyahoga; Geauga; Lake (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 19 at 3:47AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...Locally Heavy Rainfall and Melting Snow May Cause Ponding on Area Roadways.... Locally heavy rainfall has occured across the eastern portions of Cuyahoga County eastward into Lake and Geauga Counties. Area creeks have seen rises and may be bankfull in several locations. Also of concern are the locations that got a slushy accumulation of snow as warmer temperatures spill southward off the lake. This snow should begin to melt and add to the locally heavy rainfall that has occured. Several locations cross the higher terrain of Geauga County may have seen 2 to 3 inches of snow that will melt through sunrise. The snow may block some of the normal drainage for a few locations and add to some localized flooding. Motorists need to be prepared for the ponding of water on area roadways. Slow down to avoid hydroplaning. If flooding is observed please report it to the National Weather Service in Cleveland through social media. On twitter @NWSCLE, and on facebook using US National Weather Service Cleveland.
